author: Aris Folley
description: Welcome to The Hill's Business & Economy newsletter {beacon} Business & Economy Business & Economy   The Big Story  Economists sound alarm over Trump firing Economists across the political spectrum spent the weekend sounding alarm bells about what President Trump’s recent firing of the Labor Department’s top statistician means for the country. © Greg Nash...
title: Economists sound alarm over Trump firing

author: Julia Shapero
description: {beacon} Technology Technology   The Big Story  Massive AI spending shows early payoff for Big Tech The billions of dollars Big Tech has poured into artificial intelligence (AI) development seem to be paying off as companies show they can produce results, earning Wall Street’s stamp of approval for now.  © Kin Cheung, Associated Press After...
title: Massive AI spending shows early payoff for Big Tech

author: Tara Suter
description: Radio host Charlamagne tha God responded on his show Monday to recent comments from President Trump calling him a “racist sleazebag,” mostly shrugging off the insults and saying he wants the president to succeed. “Now, the personal insults, I don't care. He called me a sleazebag. I looked up the definition of sleazebag, says it's...
title: Charlamagne tha God responds to Trump's 'racist sleazebag' remark

author: Amie Parnes
description: A slew of potential Democratic presidential candidates are taking front-line positions in the battle over Texas and redistricting, a fight with huge implications for the midterm elections that is giving ambitious politicians a chance to show their loyalty to the party base. California Gov. Gavin Newsom and Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker, who could both be...
title: Texas becomes battling ground for Democratic presidential hopefuls

description: Texas House Democratic Caucus Chair Rep. Gene Wu and other members of his party who fled to Illinois over the weekend are expected to speak Monday evening in Chicago. The House Democrats left Texas on Sunday in a bid to stop Republicans from proceeding with a redistricting effort that would give the GOP five more...
title: Watch live: Texas Democrats speak in Chicago

author: Caroline Vakil
description: The decision by Texas Democrats to flee the state has ratcheted up tensions and started a new phase in the redistricting war around the country.  Democrats from the Lone Star State’s Legislature fled to Illinois, New York and Massachusetts starting Sunday to avoid giving Republicans the quorum needed to pass a highly unusual effort for...
title: Texas redistricting war escalates across the country

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr said Monday he is “reviewing” whether to remove all members of an influential advisory committee that offers guidance about preventive health services.  The U.S. Preventive Services Task Force is composed of medical experts who serve four-year terms on a volunteer basis. They are appointed by...
title: RFK Jr. 'reviewing' ouster of preventive task force members

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Many Democrats describe their party as “weak” or “ineffective,” according to a new survey showing growing pessimism in the party. In the July poll, conducted by The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research, respondents were asked to share the first word that came to mind when thinking about both parties. Researchers then grouped those...
title: Many Democrats see party as 'weak,' 'ineffective': Survey

author: Addy Bink
description: For some, getting 10,000 steps a day may translate to walking five miles. New research says you may be able to take far fewer daily steps and still reap the benefits.
title: Tired of walking 10,000 steps a day? You can aim for this instead, research suggests

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem called Florida’s "Alligator Alcatraz" a model for state-run immigrant detention facilities, saying the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is hoping to create other similar sites.  "The locations we're looking at are right by airport runways that will help give us an efficiency that we've never had before," Noem told CBS News....
title: Noem: 'Alligator Alcatraz' to serve as model for detention centers nationwide

author: Jonathan Easley
description: The redistricting arms race is on.
title: 'We are at war': Redistricting fights explode across US

author: Kyler Swaim
description: A former NFL player and Oklahoma native has been convicted of multiple federal charges months after officials seized 190 dogs from an alleged animal fighting venture, according to court documents.
title: Ex-NFL player convicted in Oklahoma of dog-fighting-related charges after 190 dogs seized

author: Jordan Perkins
description: The recall affects more than 64,000 pounds of butter.
title: FDA upgrades nationwide butter recall alert to a higher level

author: David Ibsen, opinion contributor
description: The U.S. anti-money laundering framework is outdated and is causing unintended consequences, such as the debanking of lawful customers, and needs to be modernized to ensure that banks can provide relevant and actionable information to law enforcement while maintaining relationships with lawful customers.
title: Why you're getting debanked, and how lawmakers can stop it happening

author: Keefe Harrison, opinion contributor
description: The CIRCLE Act is a bipartisan bill that would create a 30 percent investment tax credit for businesses, nonprofits and individuals building or upgrading recycling infrastructure, which could create 200,000 jobs, return $8.8 billion in materials to the economy and save taxpayers nearly $10 billion in five years.
title: The CIRCLE Act: A blueprint for revitalizing American manufacturing through recycling

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The number of people with COVID-19 in the U.S. is low but increasing, according to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention data released Friday.  COVID-19 is trending up in many Mid-Atlantic, Southeast, Southern, and West Coast states. The agency said infections are “growing or likely growing” in 40 states, based on emergency department visit data as...
title: Where the summer COVID-19 infections are hitting hardest

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: American Eagle Outfitters Inc. stock soared Monday after President Trump voiced support for actor Sydney Sweeney’s controversial “great jeans” ad campaign. The stock was up more than 17 percent by midday Monday. At last week’s close, shared were down 36 percent this year, Bloomberg reported. “Sydney Sweeney, a registered Republican, has the ‘HOTTEST’ ad out...
title: American Eagle stock jumps after Trump praises Sweeney ad campaign

author: Colin Meyn
description: President Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff is expected to visit Russia this week for what Ukraine is calling Moscow’s “last chance” to reach a peace deal before U.S. sanctions are imposed on countries that import oil from Russia.  Trump on Sunday said Witkoff “may be going to Russia” on Wednesday or Thursday this week in...
title: Witkoff set to visit Russia for 'last chance’ talks on Ukraine war

author: Asher Deinken
description: The South Dakota Highway Patrol has released a list of crashes and arrests that occurred over the course of one day at the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally.
title: 18 motorcycle crashes reported in single day at Sturgis Rally in South Dakota

author: Colin Grabow, opinion contributor
description: The BOOTS Act would restrict U.S. servicemembers to wearing only boots made in the U.S., which would limit their choices, increase their costs, and put their well-being at risk, all while benefiting domestic bootmakers.
title: The BOOTS Act is protectionism masquerading as patriotism

author: Mychael Schnell
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) is questioning her place in the Republican Party after finding herself at odds with others in the GOP — including President Trump — over several issues. The remarks — made during an interview with the Daily Mail — comes after Greene said Israel is conducting a “genocide” in Gaza; vocally pushed for the release...
title: Marjorie Taylor Greene says she's not sure if GOP is ‘leaving me’

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump said on Monday he will raise tariffs on India for buying and selling oil from Moscow, arguing that the country doesn’t care about the Ukrainian casualties from the war with Russia. The president didn’t say how much the tariff will increase on India, after he said he would impose a 25 percent tariff...
title: Trump to raise tariffs further on India over Russia oil purchases

author: Sam Stark
description: Several Texas lawmakers left the state Sunday in order to block a Monday vote on redrawn congressional maps designed to add five Republican seats in the US House of Representatives.
title: Texas Democrats explain quorum breaking, Republicans demand arrests to force Trump-ordered redistricting vote

author: Laura Kelly
description: A top aide to President Trump on Sunday accused India of financing Russia’s war in Ukraine by purchasing oil from Moscow, remarks that come days ahead of possible White House action to impose major sanctions on countries buying Russian oil.  "What he [Trump] said very clearly is that it is not acceptable for India to...
title: Trump aide accuses India of financing Russia's war on Ukraine

author: Svante Myrick, opinion contributor
description: Now that voters have given Trump power, he has abandoned many of the promises he made.
title: Trump's broken pledges are stacking up to cartoonish heights

description: Gov. Greg Abbott has threatened to remove from office the Texas House Democrats who fled the state if they don't show up for work. Many Texas Democrats left on Sunday to keep the state House from recording a quorum in its Monday legislative session, preventing the chamber from doing business. The Democrats fanned out across...
title: Live updates: Abbott threatens to force out Dems who left Texas amid redistricting fight

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: Have congressional Republicans forgotten the political pain they suffered when President George W. Bush tried to privatize Social Security in 2005?
title: If Trump and the GOP keep this up, AOC is going to be president

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump told reporters Sunday he plans to announce a new commissioner for the Bureau of Labor Statistics in the next three or four days after he fired the previous BLS leader in the wake of a jobs report that found the labor market stalling. "We'll be announcing a new statistician sometime over the next...
title: Trump says he'll name BLS chief, Fed governor in coming days

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie (R) criticized President Trump on Sunday for firing his commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), saying the president was acting like a “petulant child.” The president’s longtime ally-turned-foe said he’s not surprised the president responded to the poor jobs data on Friday by blaming the messenger. “When...
title: Christie knocks Trump for firing jobs data chief: 'Petulant child'

author: Jamal Abdi, opinion contributor
description: A move is afoot not only to manufacture consent for war, but to manufacture fear and surrender to the idea that war is inevitable.
title: Iranian Americans are demanding peace, not war

author: Felipe Jafet, opinion contributor
description: In the end, there was no one left to guard the guards.
title: Trump is right about Brazil

author: Julia Manchester
description: Rep. Nancy Mace (R) launched her run for South Carolina governor early Monday, joining a crowded Republican primary field to succeed Gov. Henry McMaster (R-S.C.).  Mace posted a video that concludes with a graphic that reads "Nancy Mace For Governor." "Do you like our X header?" she asked in a post on the social media...
title: Nancy Mace launches South Carolina governor bid

author: Kristina Karisch
description: In today's issue: ▪ How will redistricting affect 2026? ▪ Trump defends firing of labor official ▪ RFK Jr. targets childhood vaccine program ▪ Netanyahu, Putin provide foreign policy headaches Democrats are escalating their battle against Republicans’ push to redraw political maps and give themselves a lift ahead of the 2026 midterms. In Texas, Democratic legislators on Sunday took...
title: Redistricting battle heats up amid Texas showdown

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Republican lawmakers are cautioning President Trump and Attorney General Pam Bondi to be very careful about granting a pardon to Ghislaine Maxwell, the Jeffrey Epstein confidante, or commuting her 20-year sentence for sex trafficking. Republican senators are waving the caution flag after Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche met with Maxwell in Florida recently to gather...
title: GOP lawmakers caution Trump, Bondi on Maxwell pardon

author: Mike Lillis
description: The winds are shifting in congressional attitudes towards Israel. Traditional bipartisan support is eroding on Capitol Hill as Israel’s war with Hamas in Gaza has dragged on and the Palestinian casualties have soared. The pushback is surfacing in different forms and varying degrees of formality. There have been  votes to block U.S. weapons sales and...
title: Hunger crisis in Gaza deepens criticisms of Israel on Capitol Hill

author: Jared Gans
description: Democrats looking to keep up with the GOP’s push to redraw House lines are grappling with how to circumvent the same independent redistricting commissions they once championed. The movement to set up nonpartisan commissions for redistricting caught steam over the last decade, with Democrats at the forefront of the movement. Many in the party argued...
title: In redistricting fight, Dems hamstrung by commissions they championed

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Former University of Tennessee football coach Derek Dooley launched a bid on Monday for the Republican nod to take on Sen. Jon Ossoff (D-Ga.) next year, adding a high-profile name to one of the midterms' most consequential contests. Dooley is the son of former University of Georgia football coach Vince Dooley, an icon in Georgia...
title: Ex-football coach Derek Dooley challenges Jon Ossoff in Georgia

description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) visited Jerusalem on Sunday after he previously postponed a trip to Israel earlier this year. Johnson was seen in footage visiting the Western Wall in Jerusalem and joining a group of House Republicans to meet with Israeli officials. “It is such a moving time for us to be here, to...
title: Johnson visits Jerusalem after Israel trip postponed
